metadata.Title: CVE-2018-5146 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
An out of bounds memory write while processing Vorbis audio data was reported through the Pwn2Own contest. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 59.0.1, Firefox ESR < 52.7.2, and Thunderbird < 52.7.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-5146` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 59.0.1+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-globalmenu - 59.0.1+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 59.0.1+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-testsuite - 59.0.1+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

libvorbis0a - 1.3.5-3ubuntu0.2
libvorbisenc2 - 1.3.5-3ubuntu0.2
libvorbisfile3 - 1.3.5-3ubuntu0.2
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:52.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
thunderbird-globalmenu - 1:52.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:52.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:52.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
thunderbird-testsuite - 1:52.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:52.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:52.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:52.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '59.0.1+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
libvorbis package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.3.5-3ubuntu0.2').
thunderbird package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:52.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
